english: Wuchang; historic city in Hubei; district of Wuhan

etymology.description: 武 (martial) + 昌 (prosperous; flourishing) = place name implying “martial prosperity.”
etymology.interpretation: Historic toponym chosen to signal a flourishing military power during the Three Kingdoms era (renamed by Sun Quan). Now denotes the Wuchang district of Wuhan in Hubei.

examples.chinese: 武昌起义发生在1911年(武昌起義發生在1911年)，是辛亥革命的开端(是辛亥革命的開端)。
examples.pinyin: Wǔchāng Qǐyì fāshēng zài yī jiǔ yī yī nián, shì Xīnhài Gémìng de kāiduān.
examples.english: The Wuchang Uprising occurred in 1911 and marked the beginning of the Xinhai Revolution.

examples.chinese: 我住在武汉的武昌区(我住在武漢的武昌區)，离东湖很近(離東湖很近)。
examples.pinyin: Wǒ zhù zài Wǔhàn de Wǔchāng Qū, lí Dōnghú hěn jìn.
examples.english: I live in Wuchang District of Wuhan, very close to East Lake.

examples.chinese: 历史上(歷史上)，武昌曾是重要的军事和政治中心(武昌曾是重要的軍事和政治中心)。
examples.pinyin: Lìshǐ shàng, Wǔchāng céng shì zhòngyào de jūnshì hé zhèngzhì zhōngxīn.
examples.english: Historically, Wuchang was an important military and political center.
